column1: #Text=Single crystals of ZrSiS, as shown in Fig. 1(b), were grown in using a two-step chemical vapor transport process using I2 as the transport agent.
#Text=A silica ampoule with length of 20–30 cm and ID/OD of 1.8/2.0 mm was used for the synthesis and growth.
#Text=In the first step for direct solid state reaction, a stoichiometric amount of 5 N purity precursors of Zr:Si:S = 1:1:1 molar ratio was sealed in an evacuated quartz ampoule.
#Text=The vacuum-sealed quartz ampoule containing ternary mixtures was treated at 1100 °C for one week and then furnace-cooled to room temperature.
#Text=The polycrystalline ZrSiS sample was confirmed to be single phase.

#Text=In the second step, the polycrystalline powder of ZrSiS was mixed with I2 in weight ratio of 100:1 and vacuum-sealed in a two-zone tube furnace having a thermal gradient of about 1100–950 °C within ~30 cm.
#Text=After a period of 10 days, single crystals of ZrSiS with size up to 4.0 × 2.9 × 3.0 mm3 were obtained.
#Text=The ZrSiS single crystals have shiny cleaved surface with a morphology of well-defined crystal planes indexed as (100), (110), and (001), as shown in the inset of Fig. 1(b).
